name: Richest Customer Wealth
title: Richest Customer Wealth
content:
You are given an m x n integer grid accounts where accounts[i][j] is the amount of money the i​​​​​​​​​​​th​​​​ customer has in the j​​​​​​​​​​​th​​​​ bank. Return the wealth that the richest customer has.

A customer's wealth is the amount of money they have in all their bank accounts. The richest customer is the customer that has the maximum wealth.

 

Example 1:

Input: accounts = [[1,2,3],[3,2,1]]
Output: 6
Explanation:
1st customer has wealth = 1 + 2 + 3 = 6
2nd customer has wealth = 3 + 2 + 1 = 6
Both customers are considered the richest with a wealth of 6 each, so return 6.

Example 2:

Input: accounts = [[1,5],[7,3],[3,5]]
Output: 10
Explanation: 
1st customer has wealth = 6
2nd customer has wealth = 10 
3rd customer has wealth = 8
The 2nd customer is the richest with a wealth of 10.

Example 3:

Input: accounts = [[2,8,7],[7,1,3],[1,9,5]]
Output: 17

 

Constraints:

  • m == accounts.length
  • n == accounts[i].length
  • 1 <= m, n <= 50
  • 1 <= accounts[i][j] <= 100

discussion_posts.name: rubelbgdsa
discussion_posts.content: You can solve this problem by iterating through the accounts array and summing the wealth of each customer. You can then compare each customer\'s wealth to a variable that keeps track of the maximum wealth, updating the maximum wealth if a customer\'s wealth is greater than the current maximum.

For beginners who are trying to approach this problem;
1. Iterate through every row and save the sum in a variable.
2. Compare sum of current row and previous row by using if-else condition (2 variables. One for current, another for previous) for each row
3. Return max sum value
